data.name: Automated Question Type Coding for Forensic Interviews
data.description: üî• Led the development of an automated question coding system using real forensic interview data. Introduced a novel 4-type model that achieved high human-machine agreement, demonstrating accuracy rates of 82% for non-questions, 82% for option-posing questions, 98% for wh-questions, and 96% for invitations, leveraging oversampling techniques and fine-tuning the RoBERTa  model from HuggingFace for optimal performance.

data.name: Text Based Image Retrieval via Low-Resourced Indic Languages
data.description: üì¶ Contributed to a resilient image retrieval system for low-resourced Indic languages. Implemented a Siamese network with triplet loss, achieving 68.83% and 66.66% accuracy for English and Hindi models which is 2% more than the current benchmarks, and utilized MuRIL for effective text embedding.

data.name: Constellation: An End-to-End Machine Learning Platform
data.description: üåÄ  Played a pivotal role in building a potent MLOps platform, reducing model deployment and management time by 70%. Directed the creation of a user-friendly SDK for seamless integration, boosting efficiency. Architected vital features like model versioning, automated testing, and performance monitoring, yielding a 50% accuracy improvement. Utilized AutoML for 60% faster model selection and 75% quicker hyperparameter tuning and feature engineering.

data.name: Helmet and Number Plate Detector
data.description: ‚öôÔ∏è  Developed a prototype using YOLOv5 achieving 78% accuracy in detecting helmet-less riders and capturing number plates. Applied object detection for precise helmet detection and used PyTesseract OCR for extracting text from the detected number plates.

data.name: Foreign Object Debris (FOD) Detection on Runways
data.description: üöÄ   Conducted research into FOD detection, focusing on CNN-based object detection and segmentation techniques. Explored the potential of millimeter-wave and radio waves technologies for FOD detection. Presented findings in a seminar, effectively communicating the research on advanced FOD detection approaches.
